intro: Xerophyta melleri, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems that store water, aiding in its survival in arid environments. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. Xerophyta melleri is well adapted to hot, dry climates and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
